RegisterGroup.name: CHAN0_CIPHER_DOUT
RegisterGroup.description:
CHAN0_CIPHER_DOUT is the CIPHER output register for channel 0 (for single-blockencryption/decryption).The data read from this register is the results of a single-block operation. The results of theAES algorithm are different from those of the DES or 3DES algorithm. The details are asfollows:
  • For the AES algorithm- If the 1-CFB mode is selected, the least significant bit (LSB) is valid, that is,CIPHER_DOUT bit[0] is valid.- If the 8-CFB mode is selected, lower eight bits are valid, that is, CIPHER_DOUTbit[7:0] is valid.- If the 128-CFB mode is selected, 128 bits are valid.- In other modes, 128 bits are valid.
  • For the DES or 3DES algorithm- If the 1-CFB or 1-OFB mode is selected, the LSB is valid, that is, CIPHER_DOUTbit[0] is valid.- If the 8-CFB or 8-OFB mode is selected, lower eight bits are valid, that is,CIPHER_DOUT bit[7:0] is valid.- If the 64-CFB or 64-OFB mode is selected, lower 64 bits are valid, that is,CIPHER_DOUT bit[63:0] is valid.- In other modes, lower 64 bits are valid, that is, CIPHER_DOUT bit[63:0] is valid.

Member.name: chan0_cipher_dout
Member.description:
128-bit block output of the CIPHER module. Each address maps to a 32-bit data segment.
CIPHER_DOUT[31:0]: address 0x0000
CIPHER_DOUT[63:32]: address 0x0004
CIPHER_DOUT[95:64]: address 0x0008
CIPHER_DOUT[127:96]: address 0x000C

RegisterGroup.name: CHAN0_CIPHER_IVOUT
RegisterGroup.description:
CHAN0_CIPHER_IVOUT is an operation complete IV output register of the CIPHERmodule.Note the following points when reading this register:
  • This register can be ignored in ECB or CTR mode.
  • If a single-block operation is performed, the data of this register is the vector output ofthe block. The data can be used as the vector input in the next block operation for thesame data packet.- If the AES algorithm is selected, 128 bits are valid.- If the DES or 3DES algorithm is selected (CIPHER_CTRL[cipher_mode] = 0b00,0b01, or 0b11), lower 64 bits are valid, that is, CIPHER_IVOUT bit[63:0] is valid.
  • If a multi-block operation is performed, the data read from this register is the outputvector of the last block operation.- If the AES algorithm is selected, 128 bits are valid.- If the DES or 3DES algorithm is selected, lower 64 bits are valid, that is,CIPHER_IVOUT bit[63:0] is valid.

Member.name: chan0_cipher_ivout
Member.description:
Vector output after the operation of the CIPHER module is complete. It can be ignored in ECB or CTR mode. Each address maps to a 32-bit data segment.
CIPHER_DOUT[31:0]: address 0x0010
CIPHER_IVOUT[63:32]: address 0x0014
CIPHER_IVOUT[95:64]: address 0x0018
CIPHER_IVOUT[127:96]: address 0x001C

RegisterGroup.name: CHAN_CIPHER_IVOUT
RegisterGroup.description: CHAN_CIPHER_IVOUT is the IV output register for channels 1–7.

Member.name: chan_cipher_ivout
Member.description:
0x0020–0x002C: channel 1
0x0030–0x003C: channel 2
0x0040–0x004C: channel 3
0x0050–0x005C: channel 4
0x0060–0x006C: channel 5
0x0070–0x007C: channel 6
0x0080–0x008C: channel 7

RegisterGroup.name: CIPHER_KEY
RegisterGroup.description:
CIPHER_KEY is a CPU configuration key register of the CIPHER module. The key is theconfigured value of the CPU, and the CPU can be read or written.Note the following points when configuring this register:
  • If the DES algorithm is selected, lower 64 bits are valid, that is, CIPHER_KEY[63:0] isvalid.
  • For the 3DES algorit
    • T)If a 3-key operation is performed (CIPHER_CTRL[key_length] = 0b00, 0b01, or 0b10),low 192 bits are valid.where- CIPHER_KEY bit[63:0] indicates key 1.- CIPHER_KEY bit[127:64] indicates key 2.- CIPHER_KEY bit[191:128] indicates key 3.If a 2-key operation is selected (CIPHER_CTRL[key_length] = 0b11), lower 128 bits arevalid.where- CIPHER_KEY bit[63:0] indicates key 1.- CIPHER_KEY bit[127:64] indicates key 2.
  • For the AES algorithm- If a 128-bit key operation is performed, lower 128 bits are valid, that is,CIPHER_KEY bit[127:0] is valid.- If a 192-bit key operation is performed, lower 192 bits are valid, that is,CIPHER_KEY bit[191:0] is valid.- If a 256-bit key operation is performed, 256 bits are valid.The CIPHER module allows you to configure eight keys. Each channel can use one key, andmultiple channels can share one key.

Member.name: cipher_key
Member.description:
Key input of the CIPHER module. Each address maps to a 32-bit data segment.
CIPHER_KEY[31:0]: address 0x0090
CIPHER_KEY[63:32]: address 0x0094
CIPHER_KEY[95:64]: address 0x0098
CIPHER_KEY[127:96]: address 0x009C
CIPHER_KEY[159: 128]: address 0x00A0
CIPHER_KEY[191:160]: address 0x00A4
CIPHER_KEY[223:192]: address 0x00A8
CIPHER_KEY[255:224]: address 0x00AC
0x0090–0x00AC: host_key0
0x00B0–0x00CC: host_key1
0x00D0–0x00EC: host_key2
0x00F0–0x010C: host_key3
0x0110–0x012C: host_key4
0x0130–0x014C: host_key5
0x0150–0x016C: host_key6
0x0170–0x018C: host_key7

RegisterGroup.name: CHAN0_CIPHER_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description:
CHAN0_CIPHER_CTRL is the encryption/decryption control register for channel 0. Channel0 is a single-block encryption/decryption channel.Note the following points when configuring this register:
  • Configure this register before configuring others registers of the CIPHER module.
  • In the modes except the CFB mode of the AES algorithm, the CIPHER_CTRL[width]cannot be set to 01 or 10.
  • In the modes except the CFB and OFB modes of the DES and 3DES algorithms,CIPHER_CTRL[width] cannot be set to 01 or 10.

Member.name: key_adder
Member.description:
ID of the key used by the current channel.
000: host_key0
001: host_key1
010: host_key2
011: host_key3
100: host_key4
101: host_key5
110: host_key6
111: host_key7

Member.name: key_sel
Member.description:
Key select.
0: keys configured by the CPU
1: keys generated by the key management module

Member.name: key_length
Member.description:
Key length select.
For the AES algorithm:
00: 128 bits
01: 192 bits
10: 256 bits
11: 128 bits
For the DES algorithm:
00: 3 keys
01: 3 keys
10: 3 keys
11: 2 keys

Member.name: ivin_sel
Member.description:
Input select of CIPHER_IVIN.
0: do not configure CIPHER_IVIN
1: configure CIPHER_IVIN

Member.name: width
Member.description:
Bit width control.
For the DES or 3DES algorithm:
00: 64 bits
01: 8 bits
10: 1 bit
11: 64 bits
For the AES algorithm:
00: 128 bits
01: 8 bits
10: 1 bit
11: 128 bits

Member.name: alg_sel
Member.description:
Algorithm select.
00: DES algorithm
01: 3DES algorithm
10: AES algorithm
11: DES algorithm

Member.name: mode
Member.description:
Operating mode select.
For the AES algorithm:
000: ECB mode
001: CBC mode
010: CFB mode
011: OFB mode
100: CTR mode
Other values: ECB mode
For the DES algorithm:
000: ECB mode
001: CBC mode
010: CFB mode
011: OFB mode
Other values: ECB mode

Member.name: decrypt
Member.description:
Encryption/decryption select.
0: encryption
1: decryption

RegisterGroup.name: CHAN0_CIPHER_IVIN
RegisterGroup.description:
CHAN0_CIPHER_IVIN is the CIPHER VI block input register for channel 0.Assume that channel 0 is selected for the single-block encryption/decryption and the selectedmode is not ECB mode (CIPHER_CTRL[mode] = 0b001, 0b010, 0b011, or 0b100).
  • If you do not want to configure the input vector (CIPHER_CTRL[ivin_sel] = 0b0),CIPHER_IVIN can be ignored.
  • If you want to configure the input vector (CIPHER_CTRL[ivin_sel] = 0b1),CIPHER_IVIN needs to be configured. If the AES algorithm is selected(CIPHER_CTRL [alg_sel] = 0b10), CIPHER_IVIN bit[127:0] is valid. If the DES or3DES algorithm is selected (CIPHER_CTRL[alg_sel] = 0b00, 0b01, or 0b11), lower 64bits are valid, that is, CIPHER_IVIN bit[63:0] is valid.

Member.name: chan0_cipher_ivin
Member.description:
128-bit IV of the CIPHER module for channel 0 or the data input from the counter. Each address maps to a 32-bit data segment.
CIPHER_IVIN[31:0]: address 0x1004
CIPHER_IVIN[63:32]: address 0x1008
CIPHER_IVIN[95:64]: address 0x100C
CIPHER_IVIN[127:96]: address 0x1010

RegisterGroup.name: CHAN0_CIPHER_DIN
RegisterGroup.description:
CHAN0_CIPHER_DIN is a 128-bit block input register of the CIPHER module.Note the following points when configuring this register:If channel 0 is selected for the single-block operation, this register needs to be configured.
  • Assume that the AES algorithm (CIPHER_CTRL[alg_sel] = 0b10) is selected.- If the 1-CFB mode is selected, the LSB is valid, that is, CIPHER_DIN bit[0] is valid.- If the 8-CFB mode is selected, lower eight bits are valid, that is, CIPHER_DINbit[7:0] is valid.- If the 128-CFB mode is selected, 128 bits are valid.- In other modes, 128 bits are valid.
  • Assume that the DES or the 3DES algorithm (CIPHER_CTRL[alg_sel] = 0b00, 0b01, or0b11) is selected.- If the 1-CFB or 1-OFB mode is selected, the LSB is valid, that is, CIPHER_DINbit[0] is valid.- If the 8-CFB or 8-OFB mode is selected, lower eight bits are valid, that is,CIPHER_DIN bit[7:0] is valid.- If the 64-CFB or 64-OFB mode is selected, lower 64 bits are valid, that is,CIPHER_DIN bit[63:0] is valid.- In other modes, lower 64 bits are valid, that is, CIPHER_DIN bit[63:0] is valid.

Member.name: chan0_cipher_din
Member.description:
128-bit block input of the CIPHER module for channel 0. Each address maps to a 32-bit data segment.
CIPHER_DIN[31:0]: address 0x1014
CIPHER_DIN[63:32]: address 0x1018
CIPHER_DIN[95:64]: address 0x101c
CIPHER_DIN[127:96]: address 0x1020

RegisterGroup.name: CHANN_IBUF_NUM
RegisterGroup.description: CHANn_IBUF_NUM is the input queue total depth register for channel n (n = 1–7). Thisregister can be used to configure the count of linked list headers.

Member.name: ibuf_num
Member.description: Input queue depth, that is, count of linked list headers configured for each channel.

RegisterGroup.name: CHANN_IBUF_CNT
RegisterGroup.description: CHANn_IBUF_CNT is the pending data buffer count register for channel n in the input queue.When this register is written by using software, the logic adds the original value of the registerand the written value. After the logic processes a buffer, the value of this register is decreasedby 1.

Member.name: ibuf_cnt
Member.description: Count of buffers to be processed in the input queue.

RegisterGroup.name: CHANN_IEMPTY_CNT
RegisterGroup.description: CHANn_IEMPTY_CNT is the processed buffer count register for channel n in the inputqueue. When this register is written by software, the logic subtracts the written value from theoriginal value of this register. After the logic processes a buffer, the value of this register isincreased by 1.

Member.name: iempty_cnt
Member.description: Count of processed buffers in the input queue.

RegisterGroup.name: CHANN_INT_ICNTCFG
RegisterGroup.description: CHANn_INT_ICNTCFG is the input queue multi-packet interrupt threshold register forchannel n. When the count of buffers in the input queue processed by the logic is above thethreshold, an input queue interrupt is reported.

Member.name: int_icnt_cfg
Member.description: Input queue multi-packet interrupt threshold.

RegisterGroup.name: CHANN_CIPHER_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description:
CHANn_CIPHER_CTRL is the encryption/decryption control register for channel n.Note the following points when configuring this register:
  • You must configure this register before performing encryption or decryption using thechannel.
  • In the modes other than the CFB mode of the AES algorithm, CIPHER_CTRL[width]cannot be set to 01 or 10.
  • In the modes other than the CFB and OFB modes of the DES or 3DES algorithm,CIPHER_CTRL[width] cannot be set to 01 or 10.

RegisterGroup.name: CHANN_IAGE_TIMER

Member.name: aip_ckcfg
Member.description: Division clock of AIP MCLK. The configured value is calculated as follows: (MCLK/Frequency of the AIO clock source) x 2^27. The clock source frequency is 675 MHz, and the maximum value of the MCLK is 62.5 MHz.

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_CRG36
RegisterGroup.description: PERI_CRG36 is AIP clock and soft reset control register.

Member.name: aip_fsclk_div
Member.description:
Division relationship between the bit clock BCLK and sampling clock FS of AIP.
000: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 16.
001: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 32.
010: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 48.
011: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 64.
100: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 128.
101: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 256.
Other values: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 8.

Member.name: aip_bclk_div
Member.description:
Division relationship between the main clock MCLK and bit clock BCLK of AIP.
0000: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 1.
0001: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 3.
0010: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 2.
0011: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 4.
0100: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 6.
0101: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 8.
0110: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 12.
0111: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 16.
1000: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 24.
1001: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 32.
1010: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 48.
1011: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 64.
Other values: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 8.

Member.name: aip_bclk_pctrl
Member.description:
AIP BCLK select.
0: external BCLK of the Hi3520D
1: internal BCLK of the Hi3520D

Member.name: aip_cken
Member.description:
Polarity of AIP BCLK output.
0: normal phase
1: reverse phase

Member.name: aip_srst_req
Member.description:
AIP BCLK polarity.
0: normal phase
1: reverse phase

Member.name: aip_fsclk_div
Member.description:
AIP clock gating.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: aip_bclk_div
Member.description:
AIP soft reset request.
0: deassert reset
1: reset

RegisterGroup.name: SPI_CLK_DIV
RegisterGroup.description: SPI_CLK_DIV is the SPI clock ratio register.

Member.name: spi_clk_div
Member.description:
SPI clock ratio. The SPI clock frequency cannot be higher than 20 MHz. The value 12 MHz is recommended.
The field value ranges from 1 to 255. The value of spi_clk_div is used to define the SPI RX and RX bit rates. The formula is as follows: FSPICLK = FAPBCLK/(2 x (spi_clk_div + 1))FAPBCLK is the APB clock frequency. If the APB clock is 120 MHz and the expected SPI clock is 12 MHz, the configured value of spi_clk_div is calculated as follows: (120/12)/2 –1 = 4

RegisterGroup.name: SPI_RW
RegisterGroup.description: SPI_RW is the SPI read/write register.

Member.name: spi_busy
Member.description:
SPI read/write status indicator.
0: The SPI is idle, and a new read/write operation can be initiated over the SPI.
1: A read/write operation is being performed over the SPI, and no new operation is allowed.

Member.name: spi_start
Member.description: SPI read/write start. Writing 1 automatically clears this field. Writing has no effect when spi_busy is 1. That is, no new SPI operation is started before the previous read/write operation is complete. If a start request is sent, hardware ignores this request.

Member.name: spi_rw
Member.description:
SPI operation type.
0: write
1: read

Member.name: spi_add
Member.description:
SPI operation address.
The address range is 0–127.

Member.name: spi_rdata
Member.description: Data read from the SPI.

Member.name: spi_wdata
Member.description: Data to be written to the SPI.

Temperature sensor measurement start. This field must be set to 1.

RegisterGroup.name: TOT_OFFSET_L
RegisterGroup.description: TOT_OFFSET_L is the lower-8-bit corrected tot_offset register when the correctionalgorithm is used.

Member.name: tot_offset_l
Member.description: Corrected tot_offset by using the correction algorithm. The value is expressed by complement codes –256 to +255. That is, tot_offset is 1990 + (–256 to +255) in the correction algorithm. This field value is the lower seven bits of tot_offset.

RegisterGroup.name: TOT_OFFSET_H
RegisterGroup.description: TOT_OFFSET_H is the upper-1-bit corrected tot_offset register when the correctionalgorithm is used.

Member.name: tot_offset_h
Member.description: Corrected tot_offset by using the correction algorithm. The value is expressed by complement codes –256 to +255. That is, tot_offset is 1990 + (–256 to +255) in the correction algorithm. This field value is the upper one bit of tot_offset.

RegisterGroup.name: TEMP_OFFSET
RegisterGroup.description: TEMP_OFFSET is the temperature code word offset register corresponding to the correctioninput LUT.

Member.name: temp_offset
Member.description: Offset of the temperature code words that are input to the correction LUT. The value is expressed by the complement code and the value ranges from –32 to +31.

RegisterGroup.name: OUTSIDE_TEMP
RegisterGroup.description: OUTSIDE_TEMP is the external ambient temperature register.

Member.name: outside_temp
Member.description: Ambient temperature. The code word indicates –40°C to +140°C.

RegisterGroup.name: DIE_TEMP
RegisterGroup.description: DIE_TEMP is the RTC internal t_sensor temperature register.

Member.name: die_temp
Member.description: Internal chip temperature provided by the t_sensor in the RTC. The code word indicates –40°C to +140°C.

RegisterGroup.name: TEMP_SEL
RegisterGroup.description: TEMP_SEL is the correction algorithm input temperature source select register.

Member.name: fix_mode
Member.description:
Correction algorithm input temperature source select. This field works with temp_sel.
For details, see descriptions of the temp_sel field.

Member.name: temp_sel
Member.description:
Correction algorithm input temperature source select. This field parameter works with fix_mode.
When the chip is powered on, the value meanings for {fix_mode, temp_sel} are as follows:
00: The correction circuit temperature is read from the DIE_TEMP register.
01: The correction circuit temperature is read from the OUTSIDE_TEMP register.
1X: The correction circuit temperature is read from the OUTSIDE_TEMP register.
When the chip is powered off, the value meanings for {fix_mode, temp_sel} are as follows:
0X: The correction circuit temperature is read from the DIE_TEMP register.
1X: The correction circuit temperature is read from the OUTSIDE_TEMP register.

RegisterGroup.name: SC_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: SC_CTRL is a system control register. It is used to specify the operations that are performedby the system.CAUTIONWrite protection for this register can be enabled by configuring SC_LOCKEN. This registercan be written only when write protection is disabled.

Member.name: timeren7ov

Count clock select of timer7.

Member.name: timeren7sel

Count clock frequency select of timer7.
This bit must be set to 0.
0: 3 MHz clock
1: reserved

0: 3 MHz clock
1: reserved

Member.name: timeren0ov
Member.description:
Count clock select of timer0.
0: The enable signals are provided by the reference clock. The reference clock is specified by [timeren0sel].
1: bus clock

Member.name: timeren0sel
Member.description:
Count clock frequency select of timer0.
This bit must be set to 0.
0: 3 MHz clock
1: reserved

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this field returns 0 and writing to this field has no effect.

Member.name: remapstat
Member.description:
Status of address remap.
0: The address is not remapped.
1: The address is remapped. BOOTROM or SFC CS1 is remapped to address 0.

Member.name: remapclear
Member.description:
Address remap clear.
0: keep the remap status
1: clear the remap status
For details about the address mappings before and after remapping is cleared, see Table 1-1.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this bit returns 0 and writing to this bit has no effect.

Member.name: modestatus
Member.description:
Mode status. The current operating mode of the system is returned.
0x0: reserved
0x1: doze
0x2: slow
0x3: XTAL CTL
0x4: normal
0x6: PLL CTL
0x9: SW from XTAL
0xA: SW from PLL
0xB: SW to XTAL
0xE: SW to PLL
Other values: reserved

Member.name: modectrl
Member.description:
Mode control. This field defines the operating mode to which the system controller is switched.
000: reserved
001: doze
010: slow
100: normal
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: SC_SYSRES
RegisterGroup.description: SC_SYSRES is a system soft reset register. When any value is written to this register, thesystem controller transmits a system soft reset request to the reset module. Then the resetmodule resets the system.CAUTIONWrite protection for this register can be enabled by configuring SC_LOCKEN. This registercan be written only when write protection is disabled.

Member.name: softresreq
Member.description: The system is reset when any value is written to this register.

RegisterGroup.name: SC_IMCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: SC_IMCTRL is an interrupt mode control register. It is used to control the system mode whenan interrupt is generated.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this field returns 0x000000 and writing to this field has no effect.

Member.name: inmdtype
Member.description:
Type of the interrupt for triggering the interrupt mode of the system.
0: fast interrupt request (FIQ) interrupt
1: FIQ interrupt or interrupt request (IRQ) interrupt

Member.name: itmdctrl
Member.description:
Operating mode of the system with the lowest speed in interrupt mode. The value obtained after the values of this register and SC_CTRL[modectrl] are ORed indicates the operating mode of the system after an interrupt is generated. The definitions of these bits are as follows:
000: sleep
001: doze
01X: slow
1XX: normal

Member.name: itmden
Member.description:
Interrupt mode enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled. When an interrupt is generated, the system enters the interrupt mode.

RegisterGroup.name: SC_IMSTAT
RegisterGroup.description: SC_IMSTAT is an interrupt mode status register. It is used to check whether the system is ininterrupt mode. The system can be set to the interrupt mode forcibly by configuring thisregister.CAUTIONWhen the interrupt service routine (ISR) ends, the interrupt mode must be cleared manually.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this field returns 0x00000000 and writing to this field has no effect.

Member.name: itmdstat
Member.description:
Interrupt mode status. The bit is used by software for controlling whether the system enters the interrupt mode.
When the register is read:
0: The system is not in interrupt mode.
1: The system is in interrupt mode.
When the register is written:
0: Whether the system enters the interrupt mode is not controlled.
1: Whether the system enters the interrupt mode is controlled.

RegisterGroup.name: SC_XTALCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: SC_XTALCTRL is a crystal oscillator control register. It is used to specify the stable waittime after the clock module is initialized. The stable wait time is the period when the systemis switched from the XTAL CTL mode to the SW-to-XTAL mode.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this field returns 0x0000 and writing to this field has no effect.

Member.name: xtaltime
Member.description:
Wait time of crystal oscillator switching.
The value of this field is used to specify the time spent on switching the system mode from XTAL CTL to SW-to-XTAL. The wait cycle can be calculated as follows: (65536 – xtaltime) x T46.8 K. T46.8 K indicates the clock cycle of the 46.8 kHz clock.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this bit returns 0x0 and writing to this bit has no effect.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this field returns the written value and writing to this field has no effect.

RegisterGroup.name: SC_PLLCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: SC_PLLCTRL is a PLL control register. It is used to control whether to enable the on-chipARMPLL through software or system mode switching. It also sets the stable time of theARMPLL.CAUTIONWrite protection for this register can be enabled by configuring SC_LOCKEN. This registercan be written only when write protection is disabled.When the ARMPLL is enabled by switching the system mode (namely, by configuringSC_PLLCTRL[pllover]), the ARMPLL is disabled automatically if the system is not innormal mode.The clock frequency of the APLL is controlled by PERI_CRG0 and PERI_CRG1. When thePLL frequency is changed, a stable clock can be output only after 0.5 ms. Therefore, theplltime of this register must meet this requirement.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this bit returns 0x0 and writing to this bit has no effect.

Member.name: plltime
Member.description:
Stable time of the ARMPLL.
This time refers to the period from the start of the PLL to the output of a stable PLL clock. That is, the wait time of switching the system mode from PLL CTL to SW-to-PLL. The timeout is calculated as follows: (33554432 – plltime) x TXIN. TXIN indicates the clock cycle of the external crystal oscillator of the Hi3520D.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Reading this bit returns 0x0 and writing to this bit has no effect.

Member.name: pllover
Member.description:
Whether the ARMPLL is enabled is controlled by the software rather than system mode switching.
This bit must be set to 0.
0: The ARMPLL is enabled by switching the system mode.
1: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: PERIPHCTRL0
RegisterGroup.description: PERIPHCTRL0 is peripheral control register 0.CAUTIONWrite protection for this register can be enabled by configuring SC_LOCKEN. This registercan be written only when write protection is disabled.

Member.name: cfgsdisable
Member.description:
CPU set[4].
Disable write access to internal key configuration registers of the processor, including ICDDCR[0]=EnableSecure, secure interrupt defined in ICDICTR, and ICCICR (excluding the EnableNS bit).
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: cfgnmfi
Member.description:
CPU set[2].
CPU FIQ set to non-maskable interrupt (NMI) enable.
0: disabled
1: set the FIQs of CPU to NMIs

Member.name: cp15sdisable
Member.description:
CPU set[0].
Disable write access to internal secure registers of the processor, including c1 (SCTLR), c2 (TTBR0 and TTBCR), c3 (DACR), c10 (PRRR and NMRR), c12 (VBAR and MVBAR), and c13 (FCSEIDR) of the CP15 coprocessor.
0: disabled
1: enable

RegisterGroup.name: SC_LOCKEN
RegisterGroup.description: SC_LOCKEN is a register for locking key system control registers.

Member.name: scper_lockl
Member.description:
Register for locking key system control registers. The key registers include SC_CTRL, SC_SYSRES, SC_SYSSTAT, SC_PLLCTRL, SC_PLLFCTRL, PERIPHCTRL0, and PERIPHCTRL1.
When 0x1ACC_E551 is written to SC_LOCKEN, the write permission for all registers is enabled; when any other value is written to SC_LOCKEN, the write permission is disabled.
Reading this register returns the lock status rather than its written value.
0x0000_0000: The write permission is enabled (unlocked).
0x0000_0001: The write permission is disabled (locked).

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_LOAD
RegisterGroup.description:
TIMERx_LOAD is the initial count value register. It is used to set the initial count value ofeach timer. Each timer (timer0–timer7) has one such register.NOTE
  • The minimum valid value written to TIMERx_LOAD is 1.
  • When the value 0 is written to TIMERx_LOAD, the dual-timer module generates an interruptimmediately.If values are written to TIMERx_BGLOAD and TIMERx_LOADbefore the rising edge ofTIMCLK enabled by TIMCLKENx reaches, the count value of the next rising edge ofTIMCLK is changed to the value written to TIMERx_LOAD. As the value ofafter TIMERx_BGLOAD is read is the latest value that is written to TIMERx_LOAD andTTIMERx_BGLOAD. When the timer works in periodic mode and the count value decreasesto 0, the initial value is loaded from TIMERx_BGLOAD to continue counting.Total Reset Value

Member.name: timer0_load
Member.description: Initial count value of timer0

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_VALUE
RegisterGroup.description:
TIMERx_VALUE is the current count value register. It shows the current value of the counterthat is decremented. Each timer (timer0–timer7) has one such register.After a value is written to TIMERx_LOAD, TIMERx_VALUE immediately shows the newlyloaded value of the counter in the PCLK domain without waiting for the clock edge ofTIMCLK enabled by TIMCLKENx.NOTE
When a timer is in 16-bit mode, the 16 upper bits of the 32-bit TIMERx_VALUE are not set to 0automatically. If the timer is switched from 32-bit mode to 16-bit mode and no data is written toOffset Address

Member.name: timer0_value
Member.description: Current count value of timer0 that is decremented.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_CONTROL
RegisterGroup.description:
TIMERx_CONTROL is the control register. Each timer (timer0–timer7) has one such register.NOTE
When the periodic mode is selected, TIMERx_CONTROL[timermode] must be set to 1 andTIMERx_CONTROL[oneshot] must be set to 0.

Member.name: timeren
Member.description:
Timer enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: timermode
Member.description:
Timer count mode.
0: free-running mode
1: periodic mode

Member.name: intenable
Member.description:
Raw interrupt mask.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: timerpre
Member.description:
Prescaling factor configuration.
00: no prescaling. That is, the clock frequency of the timer is divided by 1
01: 4-level prescaling. That is, the clock frequency of the timer is divided by 16
10: 8-level prescaling. That is, the clock frequency of the timer is divided by 256
11: undefined. If the bits are set to 11, 8-level prescaling is considered. That is, the clock frequency of the timer is divided by 256.

Member.name: timersize
Member.description:
Counter select.
0: 16-bit counter
1: 32-bit counter

Member.name: oneshot
Member.description:
Count mode select.
0: periodic mode or free-running mode
1: one-shot mode

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_INTCLR
RegisterGroup.description: TIMERx_INTCLR is the interrupt clear register. The interrupt status of a counter is clearedafter any operation is performed on this register. Each timer (timer0–timer7) has one suchregister.CAUTIONThis register is a write-only register. The timer clears interrupts when any value is written tothis register. In addition, no value is recorded in this register and no default reset value isdefined.

Member.name: timer0_intclr
Member.description: Writing this register clears the output interrupt of timer0.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_RIS
RegisterGroup.description: TIMERx_RIS is the raw interrupt status register. Each timer (timer0–timer7) has one suchregister.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. Writing this register has no effect and reading this register returns 0.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_MIS
RegisterGroup.description: TIMERx_MIS is the masked interrupt status register. Each timer (timer0–timer7) has onesuch register.

RegisterGroup.name: TIMER0_BGLOAD
RegisterGroup.description: TIMERx_BGLOAD is the initial count value register in periodic mode. Each timer(timer0–timer7) has one such register.The TIMERx_BGLOAD register contains the initial count value of the timer. This register isused to reload an initial count value when the count value of the timer reaches 0 in periodicmode.In addition, this register provides another method of accessing TIMERx_LOAD. Thedifference is that after a value is written to TIMERx_BGLOAD, the timer does not countstarting from the input value immediately.

Member.name: timer0bgload
Member.description:
Initial count value of timer0.
Note: This register differs from TIMERx_LOAD. For details, see the descriptions of TIMERx_LOAD.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_LOAD
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_LOAD is an initial count value register. It is used to configure the initial count value ofthe internal counter of the watchdog.

Member.name: wdg_load
Member.description: Initial count value of the watchdog counter.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_VALUE
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_VALUE is a current count value register It is used to read the current count value ofthe internal counter of the watchdog.

Member.name: wdogvalue
Member.description: Current count value of the watchdog counter.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_CONTROL
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_CONTROL is a control register. It is used to enable or disable the watchdog andcontrol the interrupt and reset functions of the watchdog.

Member.name: resen
Member.description:
Output enable of the watchdog reset signal.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: inten
Member.description:
Output enable of the watchdog interrupt signal.
0: The counter stops counting, the current count value remains unchanged, and the watchdog is disabled.
1: The counter, interrupt and watchdog are enabled.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_INTCLR
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_INTCLR is an interrupt clear register. It is used to clear watchdog interrupts so thewatchdog can reload an initial value for counting. This register is write-only. When a value iswritten to this register, the watchdog interrupts are cleared. No written value is recorded inthis register and no default reset value is defined.

Member.name: wdg_intclr
Member.description: Writing any value to this register clears the watchdog interrupts and enables the watchdog to reload an initial count value from WDG_LOAD to restart counting.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_RIS
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_RIS is a raw interrupt status register. It shows the raw interrupt status of the watchdog.

Member.name: wdogris
Member.description:
Status of the raw interrupts of the watchdog. When the count value reaches 0, this bit is set to 1.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_MIS
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_MIS is a masked interrupt status register. It shows the masked interrupt status of thewatchdog.

Member.name: wdogmis
Member.description:
Status of the masked interrupts of the watchdog.
0: No interrupt is generated or the interrupt is masked.
1: An interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: WDG_LOCK
RegisterGroup.description: WDG_LOCK is a lock register. It is used to control the write and read permissions for thewatchdog registers.

Member.name: wdg_lock
Member.description:
Writing 0x1ACC_E551 to this register enables the write permission for all the registers.
Writing other values disables the write permission for all the registers.
When this register is read, the lock status rather than the written value of this register is returned.
0x0000_0000: The write permission is available (unlocked).
0x0000_0001: The write permission is unavailable (locked).

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_STATUS
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_STATUS is a DDRC status register.

Member.name: in_init
Member.description:
Initialization status of a controller.
0: normal
1: initializing

Member.name: in_sr
Member.description:
Self-refresh status of a controller.
0: normal
1: self refreshing

Member.name: busy
Member.description:
Busy status of a controller.
0: idle
1: A command is being processed.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_SREFCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_SREFCTRL is a DDRC self-refresh control register.

Member.name: sr_req
Member.description:
SDRAM self-refresh request.
0: exit the self-refresh status
1: enter the self-refresh status

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_INITCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_INITCTRL is a DDRC initialization control register.

Member.name: init_req
Member.description:
Initialization enable.
0: Initialization is complete or initialization is performed properly.
1: The SDRAM starts to be initialized.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CTRL is a DDRC control register.

Member.name: ddr_rst_n
Member.description:
DDR3 SDRAM reset.
0: valid
1: invalid
Note: This bit is valid only for the DDR3 SDRAM and is set to 1 by default.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_EMRS01
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_EMRS01 is a DDR mode configuration register.

Member.name: emrs1
Member.description:
DDRn SDRAM extended mode register 1.
This field corresponds to valid bits 13?0 of mode register 1 (MR1) in the DDRn SDRAM user manual. MR1 bit[15:14] for most DDRs are not used. DDRC_EMRS01 bit[31:30] must be set to 0b00.
For details about MR1, see the DDRn SDRAM user manual.

Member.name: mrs
Member.description:
DDRn SDRAM mode register.
This field corresponds to valid bits 13?0 of mode register 0 (MR0) in the DDRn SDRAM user manual. MR0 bit[15:14] for most DDRs are not used. DDRC_EMRS01 bit[15:14] must be set to 0b00.
For details about MR0, see the DDRn SDRAM user manual.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_EMRS23
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_EMRS23 is a DDR extended mode configuration register.

Member.name: emrs3
Member.description:
DDRn SDRAM extended mode register 3.
This field corresponds to valid bits 13?0 of mode register 3 (MR3) in the DDRn SDRAM user manual. MR3 bit[15:14] for most DDRs are not used. DDRC_EMRS23 bit[31:30] must be set to 0b00.
For details about MR3, see the DDRn SDRAM user manual.

Member.name: emrs2
Member.description:
DDRn SDRAM extended mode register 2.
This field corresponds to valid bits 13?0 of mode register 2 (MR2) in the DDRn SDRAM user manual. MR2 bit[15:14] for most DDRs are not used. DDRC_EMRS23 bit[15:14] must be set to 0b00.
For details about MR2, see the DDRn SDRAM user manual.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CONFIG0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CONFIG0 is DDRC function configuration register 0.

Member.name: init_arefnum
Member.description:
Number of auto-refresh operations when the DDRn SDRAM is being initialized.
0x0–0x2: two
0x3–0xF: n.

Member.name: pd_prd
Member.description:
Power down cycle of the SDRAM. When the DDRC does not receive any command in pd_prd consecutive cycles, it forces the DDRn SDRAM to enter the low-power mode; when a command is received, the DDRC forces the DDRn SDRAM to exit the low-power mode.
0x00: 1 clock cycle
0x01–0xFF: n clock cycles
Note: This parameter is valid only when pd_en is 1.

Member.name: rcv_pdr
Member.description:
DDR receive I/O dynamic power-down control enable. The DDRC disables the receive buffer of the DDR data I/O in the non-read status when it is enabled.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: sr_cc
Member.description:
DDRn SDRAM clock control in self-refresh mode.
0: The DDRn SDRAM clock is enabled.
1: The DDRn SDRAM clock is disabled.

Member.name: pd_cc
Member.description:
DDRn SDRAM clock control in power-down mode.
0: The DDRn SDRAM clock is enabled.
1: The DDRn SDRAM clock is disabled.
Note: This parameter is valid only when the LPDDR SDRAM or LPDDR2 SDRAM is connected.

Member.name: pd_en
Member.description:
Automatic low-power enable of the DDRn SDRAM.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ddrc_2t_sel
Member.description:
2T timing mode select.
0: In the DDR interface, the CS_N signal is valid for one cycle; the RAS_N, CAS_N, WE_N, and address signals are valid for two cycles.
1: In the DDR interface, the CS_N signal is active low; the RAS_N, CAS_N, and WE_N, signals are valid for one cycle; and the address signal is valid for two cycles.

Member.name: ddrc_2t_en
Member.description:
2T timing enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: rank
Member.description:
Rank configuration of the DDRC.
00: 1 rank
Other values: reserved

Member.name: dram_type
Member.description:
External memory type.
101: DDR2
110: DDR3
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mem_width
Member.description:
Bit width of the storage data bus.
00: 16 bits
01: 32 bits
Other values: reserved

Member.name: brst_a12
Member.description:
DDR3 SDRAM A12 command enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: The recommended value is 0.

Member.name: brstlen
Member.description:
Burst length of the DDRC.
0: burst4
1: burst8
When the ratio of the frequency of the DDRC to the frequency of the PHY is 1:1, the burst length of the DDR2 SDRAM can be set to burst 4 or burst 8. The burst length of the DDR3 SDRAM can only be set to burst 8.
When the ratio of the frequency of the DDRC to the frequency of the PHY is 1:2, the burst length of the DDR2 SDRAM and the DDR3 SDRAM can only be set to burst 4

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CONFIG1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CONFIG1 is DDRC function configuration register 1.

Member.name: sref_arefnum
Member.description:
Number of times of auto refresh operations after DDRn SDRAM exits auto refresh in DFS process.
0x0–0x1: once
0x2–0xF: n times
Note: This field is valid only when train_en is 1. When train_en is 0, DDRn SDRAM exits self refresh and DDRC does not perform auto refresh operation.

Member.name: sref_zqc_en
Member.description:
ZQ calibration long enable when the DDR exits the self-refresh state.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: This bit is valid for the DDR3 or LPDDR2 mode.If the DDR is in the self-refresh state for a long time, set this bit to 1.

Member.name: clk_switch
Member.description:
DDRC low-power clock switch control. This field determines whether to perform back pressure on AXI port command when DDRC enters the low-power status (DDR self refresh).
0: not perform back pressure on the command and return the error response.
1: perform back pressure on the command and run the original command when the clock is switched.

Member.name: odis_ddrio
Member.description:
Output disable configuration of the DDR command and data I/O.
0: enable the pin output
1: disable the pin output
Note: This is a static configuration. When DDR enters the self–refresh mode, set DDR to 1 to disable the DDR command and data I/O output. Before DDR exits the self–refresh mode, set DDR to 0 to enable the DDR command and data I/O output.

Member.name: pd_ac
Member.description:
SDRAM address command status enable control in power-down mode.
0: enable the pin output
1: disable the pin output
Note: When pd_en is enabled, pd_ac is valid. The control pins exclude CKE, ODT, CSN, and RESET_N.

Member.name: pd_pst_opn
Member.description:
SDRAM address/command pin delay before the power-down mode is exited.
00: 0 cycles
01: 1 cycle
10: 2 cycles
11: 3cycles
Note: When pd_en is enabled, pd_pst_opn is valid. The control pins exclude CKE and RESET_N.

Member.name: pd_pre_cls
Member.description:
SDRAM address/command disable delay after the power-down mode is entered.
00: 0 cycles
01: 1 cycle
10: 2 cycles
11: 3 cycles
Note: When pd_en is enabled, pd_pre_cls is valid. The control pins exclude CKE and RESET_N.

Member.name: auto_pre_en
Member.description:
Auto precharge enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: wr_rcv_mode
Member.description:
Mode of receiving the write command over the DDRC AXI port.
0: The write command is received directly.
1: The write command is received only after the expected data to be written arrives.

Member.name: exclu_en
Member.description:
Exclusive command enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: lock_en
Member.description:
WRAP command lock enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: aref_mode
Member.description:
Auto-refresh mode select.
0: An auto-refresh operation is performed every one tREFI period.
1: Eight auto-refresh operations are performed every nine tREFI periods.

Member.name: wrlvl_en
Member.description:
Auto-control enable of the DDR3 write level hardware.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Reserved.
This field must be set to 0.

Member.name: read_mode
Member.description:
Read mode select of the DDRC.
0: associated read mode
1: delay read mode
The associated read mode is a mode in which the DDRC samples data based on the data valid signal from the PHY.
The delay read mode is a mode in which the DDRC samples the data from the PHY after the internal delay of the DDRC.
Note: This bit must be set to 0 when DDRC_DTRCTRL[train_mode] is set to 0.

Member.name: clkratio
Member.description:
Operating mode of the DDRC.
When the frequency ratio of DDRC to PHY is 1:1, this bit is set to 0.
When the frequency ratio of DDRC to PHY is 1:2, this bit is set to 1.

Member.name: ecc_en
Member.description:
ECC enable of the DDRC
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: zqc_en
Member.description:
DDR3 SDRAM ZQ enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: This bit is valid for the DDR3 SDRAM only and is set to 1 by default.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CMDCFG
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CMDCFG is a DDRC command configuration register.

Member.name: cmd_mrs
Member.description: Value of the DDR mode register when the load mode register (LMR) command is configured.

Member.name: cmd_ba
Member.description: Value of the DDR BA when the LMR command is configured.

Member.name: cmd_rank
Member.description:
Rank for running commands.
0: The configuration command is executed.
1: The configuration command is not executed.
Each bit controls a rank.
Note: As the Hi3520D only has rank0, cmd_rank must be set to 0x0 or 0x1.

Member.name: cmd_type
Member.description:
DDR command configuration.
00: enter the deep power-down mode
01: exit the deep power-down mode
10: LMR command
11: ZQCL

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_CMDEXE
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_CMDEXE is a DDRC software configuration command start register.

Member.name: cmd_req
Member.description:
Request of executing the configuration command of the DDRC.
0: The command is not executed or the parameter is cleared automatically after the command is executed.
1: The command is requested to be executed.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_RNKCFG
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_RNKCFG is a DDR feature configuration register.

Member.name: mem_map
Member.description:
Address translation mode of the SDRAM.
00: {Rank, Row, Ba, Col, DW} = AXI_Address
01: {Rank, Ba, Row, Col, DW} = AXI_Address
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mem_bank
Member.description:
Number of banks of a single SDRAM.
0: 4 banks
1: 8 banks
If there are multiple ranks, the ranks in the same channel can have different configurations. In dual-channel mode, the dual channels must have the same configuration.

Member.name: mem_row
Member.description:
Bit width of the row address of a single SDRAM.
000: 11 bits
001: 12 bits
010: 13 bits
011: 14 bits
100: 15 bits
101: 16 bits
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mem_col
Member.description:
Bit width of the column address of a single SDRAM.
000: 8 bits
001: 9 bits
010: 10 bits
011: 11 bits
100: 12 bits
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_BASEADDR
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_BASEADDR is a DDR space base address configuration register.

Member.name: mem_base_addr
Member.description: Configuration of the start base address of the DDR in the system.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING0 is DDR timing parameter register 0.

Member.name: tmrd
Member.description:
Count of wait cycles of LMR command.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trrd
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of the ACT bank A to ACT bank B command.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trp
Member.description:
Count of wait cycles for disabling commands (PRE period).
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trcd
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from the ACT bank command to the read or write bank command.
0x0–0x3: 3 clock cycles
0x4–0xF: n clock cycles

Member.name: trc
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from an ACT bank command to the next ACT bank command.
0x00–0x01: 1 clock cycle
0x02–0x3F: n clock cycles

Member.name: tras
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from ACT to PRE.
0x00–0x01: 1 clock cycle
0x02–0x0F: n clock cycles

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING1 is DDR timing parameter register 1.

Member.name: tsre
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from the self-refresh exit command to the read command.
0x0: 1 clock cycle
0x01–0xFF: n x 2 clock cycles
When the DDR3 SDRAM is used, the value is set to tXSDLL.

Member.name: trdlat
Member.description:
Inherent delay of the DDR PHY.
0x0–0xF: n + 1 clock cycles
When the Dophin PHY is used, the value is set to 0x5.
This field is valid when read_mode is 1 (delay read mode).

Member.name: trtw
Member.description:
Delay from the last read data segment to the first written data segment.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2-0xF: n + 1 clock cycles

Member.name: twl
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles from the write command to the write data.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
For example, 0x3 indicates 3 clock cycles.
Note: In DDR2 mode, tw1 is set to (tcl – 1) and the equation of twl – taond ≥ 1 must be true.
Note: The time parameter value is calculated based on the DDR SRAM clock cycle.

Member.name: tcl
Member.description:
DDR CL from the read command to the read data.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
Note: The time parameter value is calculated based on the DDR SRAM clock cycle.

Member.name: trfc
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of the AREF period or AREF to the ACT command. The register can be set to the maximum value max{trfc, tzqcs}.
0x00–0x01: 1 clock cycle
0x02–0xFF: n clock cycles

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING2
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING2 is DDR timing parameter register 2.

Member.name: tcke
Member.description:
Minimum cycle of maintaining the low-power mode.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
The value needs to be set to the maximum value among tCKESR, tCKSRE, tCKSRX, and tCKE.
When the Dophin DDR PHY is used, the value of this register needs to be set to max{tCKSRx, tCKE} + 3.

Member.name: twtr
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of the last write-to-read command.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
For example, 0x3 indicates 3 clock cycles.

Member.name: twr
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of write recovery.
0x0–0x1: 1 clock cycle
0x2–0xF: n clock cycles
Note: When DFS is required, tWR must be set to the maximum frequency in the DFS and cannot be changed with the frequency of the DDR.

Member.name: tfaw
Member.description:
Number of clock cycles of four consecutive activation commands.
0x00-0x3F: n clock cycles
For example, 0x14 indicates 20 clock cycles.

Member.name: taref
Member.description:
Number of auto-refresh cycles.
0x000: forbidden
0x001–0x7FF: The auto-refresh cycle of the SDRAM is 16 x n clock cycles.
For example, 0x008 indicates 128 clock cycles.
The configuration interval is calculated as follows: Configuration interval = tREFI/16/Tclk. tREFI is 7800 ns, and Tclk is two times of the running cycle when the SDRAM is used.
When DDRC_CONFIG1[aref_mode] is 1, the interval of DDRC_TIMING2 must be set to 8 x tREFI.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TIMING3
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TIMING3 is DDR timing parameter register 3.

Member.name: tzq_prd
Member.description:
Number of ZQCS command cycles.
0x000: The ZQCS command is forbidden.
0x001–0x3FF: n x 128 AREF cycles.
The number of ZQCS command cycles is n x 128 taref clock cycles.

Member.name: tzqinit
Member.description:
Number of delay cycles during ZQ initialization.
0x0–0x1FF: n + 1 clock cycles
The value needs to be set to the maximum value between tZQINIT and tDLLK.

Member.name: taond
Member.description:
Count of ODT enable/disable cycles.
In DDR2 mode (taond/taofd):
0x0: 2/2.5
0x1: 3/3.5
0x2: 4/4.5
0x3: 5/5.5
Other values: reserved
In DDR3 mode, the value is set to (tWL – 1).
Note: The time parameter value is calculated based on the DDR SRAM clock cycle.

Member.name: txard
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles of exiting the DDR low-power mode.
0x0–0xF: n clock cycles. The letter n indicates the corresponding decimal value.
For example, 0x7 indicates 7 clock cycles.
The value is set to the maximum value among tXP, tXARD, tXARDS, and tXS.
In DDR3 mode, when the register is set to tXS, txard only needs to be set to an equivalent clock cycle of 10 ns.

Member.name: trtp
Member.description:
Wait delay from the read command to the disable command.
000–010: 2 clock cycles
011–111: n clock cycles
Trtp is calculated as follows: AL + BL/2 + Max(trtp, 2) – 2

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_QOSCFG0
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_QOSCFG0 is DDRC QoS algorithm configuration register 0.

Member.name: idmap_mode
Member.description:
ID mapping mode.
0: The id_map mapping mode configured by the register is used by default.
1: The QoS mapping mode is used. The AXI port configures this mode in associated mode by running read/write commands. This mapping mode is valid only when its macro definition is enabled in the RTL code.
This field must be 1.

Member.name: id_order_ctl
Member.description:
Out-of –order execution enable of the specified ID.
0: disabled
1: enabled The DDRC does not ensure the order when conflict occurs between the DDR row addresses of the read/write commands with the specified ID and other IDs. Master ensures the consistency of the data.

Member.name: order_en
Member.description:
Execution order enable for the commands with the same priority.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: dmc_fifo_lvl
Member.description:
Depth of the command register FIFO in the DMC.
0x0–0xF: n + 1 command depths
Note: The maximum depth of the command register FIFO in the Hi3520D is 0xB, but it is recommended to set the depth to 0x7.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_QOSCFG1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_QOSCFG1 is DDRC QoS algorithm configuration register 1.

Member.name: id_map_rd
Member.description:
For the read command, QoS that is configured by selecting four bits based on the bus read ID.
bit[15:12]: configure bit[3] mapping to the ID
bit[11:8]: configure bit[2] mapping to the ID
bit[7:4]: configure bit[1] mapping to the ID
bit[3:0]: configure bit[0] mapping to the ID
For example, if ID_MAP is set to 0x5320, ID[5], ID[3], ID[2], and ID[0] of the bus ID are used for ID mapping and priority configuration.
The DDRC inserts three bits between the ninth bit, eighth bit and seventh bit of the existing 13-bit ID. These three bits indicate the AXI port numbers. Therefore, the bit width of the ID mapped by the DDRC is 16 bits.
000: axi port 0
001: axi port 1
010: axi port 2
011: axi port 3
100: axi port 4
101: axi port 5
110: axi port 6
111: axi port 7

Member.name: id_map_wr
Member.description:
For the read command, QoS that is configured by selecting four bits based on the bus ID.
bit[15:12]: configure bit[3] mapping to the ID
bit[11:8]: configure bit[2] mapping to the ID
bit[7:4]: configure bit[1] mapping to the ID
bit[3:0]: configure bit[0] mapping to the ID
For example, if ID_MAP is set to 0x5320, ID[5], ID[3], ID[2], and ID[0] of the bus ID are used for ID mapping and priority configuration.
The DDRC inserts three bits between the ninth bit, eighth bit and seventh bit of the existing 13-bit ID. These three bits indicate the AXI port numbers. Therefore, the bit width of the ID mapped by the DDRC is 16 bits.
000: axi port 0
001: axi port 1
010: axi port 2
011: axi port 3
100: axi port 4
101: axi port 5
110: axi port 6
111: axi port 7

Command priority adaptation configuration.
0x0: disabled
0x1?0xF: n x 16 clock cycles

Member.name: age_prd
Member.description:
Command aging cycle configuration.
0x0: disabled
0x1?0xF: n x 16 clock cycles

Member.name: qos_en
Member.description:
Command QoS enable (timeout).
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: qos
Member.description:
Command QoS configuration (timeout).
0x1?0x3FF: n clock cycles
Other values: reserved
Note: The used timeout is an integral multiple of 16. The lower four bits of rd_qos is ignored.

Member.name: pri
Member.description:
Command priority configuration.
000: highest priority
001: higher priority
…
111: lowest priority

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_FLUX
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_FLUX is a DDRC AXI port bandwidth traffic control configuration register.

Member.name: flux_port_en
Member.description:
AXI port DDRC traffic count enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: flux_ovfl
Member.description:
AXI port traffic overflow allow enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
When this bit is set to 1, the traffic of the AXI port exceeds the bandwidth limit, and no request is raised over the AXI ports without overflow, the bandwidth of the AXI port can exceed the configured value.

Member.name: flux_lvl
Member.description:
AXI port traffic overflow allow threshold.
0x0–0xC: DMC threshold for allowing traffic overflow
Other values: reserved
When flux_ovfl is set to 1, this traffic overflow over the AXI port is allowed if the traffic of the AXI port is greater than the configured bandwidth of flux and the number of the commands to be processed in DMC is less than the configured threshold.

Member.name: flux
Member.description:
Bandwidth configuration of the AXI port.
0x0–0x3FF: ratio of the maximum DDR bandwidth to the total bandwidth accessed by the AXI port. The total bandwidth is 1024. The configured value is calculated as follows: ratio of the required bandwidth to the total bandwidth x1024. For example, if 20% of bandwidth is required for this AXI port, configure flux to 0xCD.

Member.description: Commands that are being processed by the DDRC.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST1
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST1 is a DDRC test status register.

Member.name: dt_num
Member.description: Cycle n select, data read from the training module (n = 0–23).

Member.name: byte_sel
Member.description:
Channel select of the returned data.
0x0–0x7: channel n select

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST7
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST7 is a DDRC performance measurement control register.

Member.name: perf_mode
Member.description:
Performance measurement mode.
0: continuous trigger mode. The performance counter counts continuously. No data overflow occurs within 1s = (533 MHz).
1: single trigger mode. When the performance counter reaches the maximum value, the count value is retained but counting is stopped.
Note: When an overflow occurs, the count values wrap.

Member.name: perf_en
Member.description:
Performance measurement enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: When perf_mode is 0 and this bit is enabled, performance measurement register starts cyclic counting. When perf_mode is 1, this bit is cleared after counting is complete once.

Member.name: perf_ch
Member.description:
Read and write count channel.
00: disabled
01: channel 0
10: channel 1
11: channel 0 and channel 1
Note: This register limits the number of read/write command count channels of DDRC_TEST8 and DDRC_TEST9.

Member.name: perf_prd
Member.description:
Performance measurement cycle.
0x0–0xFFFFFFF: count cycles
The actual count cycle is calculated as follows: perf_prd x 4 xtclk. Where tclk is the bus clock cycle of the DDRC.
Note: This configuration is valid only when perf_mode is 1. When perf_mode is set to 0 to select the continuous count mode, the performance counters keep on counting.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST8
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST8 is a DDRC write command count register.

Member.name: wr_num
Member.description:
Count of write commands in the count period. This register is written to clear.
Wrap cycle counting is supported.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST9
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST9 is a DDRC read command count register.

Member.name: rd_num
Member.description:
Count of read commands in the count period. This register is written to clear.
Wrap cycle counting is supported.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST10
RegisterGroup.description: DDRC_TEST10 is a DDRC DMC wait command count register.

Member.name: dmc_cmd_num
Member.description:
Count of DMC wait commands of the DDRC in the count period. This register is written to clear.
Wrap cycle counting is supported.
Note: As the register width is limited and data overflow needs to be avoided within 1s under the 620 MHz clock, the displayed count value of this register is the actual count value divided by 2.

RegisterGroup.name: DDRC_TEST12

RegisterGroup.name: GLOBAL_CONFIG
RegisterGroup.description: GLOBAL_CONFIG is a global configuration register.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. This bit must be set to 0.

Member.name: flash_addr_mode
Member.description:
SPI address mode
0: 3-byte address mode (default)
1: 4-byte address mode
The write operation is invalid when CMD.start is 1.

Member.name: wp_en
Member.description:
Enable hardware write protection. The WP pin is forcibly pulled down when the bit is set to 1.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: mode
Member.description:
SPI mode configuration
0: mode 0
1: mode 3

RegisterGroup.name: TIMING
RegisterGroup.description: TIMNG is a timing configuration register.

Member.name: tcsh
Member.description:
Set the CS hold time
000–111: n + 1 clock cycles (n = 0, 1, 2, …, or 7)

Member.name: tcss
Member.description:
Set the setup time of the CS.
000–111: n + 1 clock cycles (n = 0, 1, 2, …, or 7)

Member.name: tshsl
Member.description:
Indicates the deselect time of the CS. It is equal to the interval between two flash operations.
0000–1111: n + 2 clock cycles. (n = 0, 1, 2, …, or 15)

RegisterGroup.name: INT_RAW_STATUS
RegisterGroup.description: INT_RAW_STATUS is an interrupt raw status register.

Member.name: dma_done_int_raw_status
Member.description:
Raw status of DMA operation done interrupt (not masked)
0: The operation is not complete.
1: The operation is complete.

Member.name: cmd_op_end_raw_status
Member.description:
Raw interrupt status of instruction operation end (not masked).
0: The operation is not complete.
1: The operation is complete.

RegisterGroup.name: INT_STATUS
RegisterGroup.description: INT_STATUS is a masked interrupt status register.

Member.name: dma_done_int_status
Member.description:
Raw status of DMA operation done interrupt (masked)
0: The operation is not complete.
1: The operation is complete.

Member.name: cmd_op_end_status
Member.description:
Interrupt status of instruction operation end (masked)
0: The operation is not complete.
1: The operation is complete.

RegisterGroup.name: INT_MASK
RegisterGroup.description: INT_MASK is an interrupt mask register.

Member.name: dma_done_int_mask
Member.description:
DMA operation done interrupt mask bit
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: cmd_op_end_int_mask
Member.description:
Instruction operation end interrupt mask bit
0: masked
1: not masked

RegisterGroup.name: INT_CLEAR
RegisterGroup.description: INT_CLEAR is an interrupt clear register.

Member.name: dma_done_int_clr
Member.description:
DMA done interrupt clear bit. Writing 1 to this bit clears dma_done_status and dma_done_raw_status.
0: not cleared
1: cleared
After a clear operation is complete, this bit returns 0 automatically.

Member.name: cmd_op_end_int_clr
Member.description:
Instruction operation end interrupt clear bit. Writing 1 to this bit clears cmd_op_end_status and cmd_op_end_raw_status.
0: not cleared
1: cleared
After a clear operation is complete, this bit returns 0 automatically.

0: earlier version register group

RegisterGroup.name: BUS_CONFIG1
RegisterGroup.description: BUS_CONFIG1 is the bus operation configuration register 1.

Member.name: rd_enable
Member.description:
Bus read control. The value 0 is returned when the bus reads data.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: wr_enable
Member.description:
Bus write control. Ignore the bus write operation.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: wr_ins
Member.description: Write instruction

Member.name: wr_dummy_bytes
Member.description:
Dummy byte of the bus write operation
0: no dummy byte
1: 1 byte
2: 2 bytes
...
7: 7 bytes

Member.name: wr_mem_if_type
Member.description:
Bus write operation specifies the type of the connected SPI flash interface.
000: standard SPI interface type
001: dual-Input/dual-Output SPI
010: dual-I/O SPI
011: full DIO SPI
100: reserved
101: quad-Input/Dual-Output SPI
110: quad-I/O SPI
111: full QIO SPI

Member.name: rd_ins
Member.description: Read instruction

Member.name: rd_prefetch_cnt
Member.description:
Clock cycle for prefetching data when the flash memory is accessed at a variable data length through the bus.
00: not prefetched (default)
01: prefetch the data in one clock cycle
10: prefetch the data in two clock cycles
11: prefetch the data in three clock cycles

Member.name: rd_dummy_bytes
Member.description:
Dummy byte of the bus read operation
0: no dummy byte
1: 1 byte
2: 2 bytes
...
7: 7 bytes

Member.name: rd_mem_if_type
Member.description:
Bus read operation specifies the type of the connected SPI flash interface.
000: standard SPI interface type
001: dual-Input/Dual-Output SPI
010: dual-I/O SPI
011: full DIO SPI
100: reserved
101: quad-Input/Dual-Output SPI
110: quad-I/O SPI
111: full QIO SPI

RegisterGroup.name: BUS_CONFIG2

Member.name: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: BUS_FLASH_SIZE
RegisterGroup.description: BUS_FLASH_SIZE is a bus mapping size register.

Member.name: flash_size_cs1
Member.description:
Capacity of the SPI flash connected to CS 1.
0000: 0000: No SPI flash is connected.
0001: 512 kbits
0010: 1 Mbit
0011: 2 Mbits
0100: 4 Mbits
0101: 8 Mbits
0110: 16 Mbits
0111: 32 Mbits
1000: 64 Mbits
1001: 128 Mbits (default)
1010: 256 Mbits
1011: 512 Mbits
1100: 1 Gbit
1101: 2 Gbits
1110: 4 Gbits
1111: 8 Gbits

RegisterGroup.name: CS1_BUS_BASE_ADDR

Member.description: The CS1 flash memory is mapped to the system space address.

RegisterGroup.name: BUS_ALIAS_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: BUS_ALIAS_ADDR is a bus alias base address register.

Member.name: flash_alias_addr
Member.description: The flash memory is mapped to the second base address of the system space.

RegisterGroup.name: BUS_DMA_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: BUS_DMA_CTRL is a DMA control register.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
DMA操作指定片选。
0：片选0采用DMA方式；
1：片选1采用DMA方式。

Member.name: rw
Member.description:
DMA read and write indication.
0: write operation (write data to the flash memory)
1: read operation (read data from the flash memory)

Member.name: start
Member.description:
DMA transfer enable control
0: no operation or the operation is complete.
1: Writing 1 to this bit to enable the DMA operation. Read 1 from this bit indicates the DMA is operating.
The value 0 is automatically returned after the DMA operation is complete.

RegisterGroup.name: BUS_DMA_MEM_SADDR
RegisterGroup.description: BUS_DMA_MEM_SADDR is DMA DDR start address register.

Member.name: dma_mem_saddr
Member.description:
DMA DDR start address.
The start address must be 4-byte aligned.

RegisterGroup.name: BUS_DMA_FLASH_SADDR
RegisterGroup.description: BUS_DMA_MEM_SADDR is a DMA flash start address register.

Member.name: dma_flash_saddr
Member.description: DMA flash start address.

RegisterGroup.name: BUS_DMA_LEN
RegisterGroup.description: BUS_DMA_LEN is a DMA transfer data length register.

Member.name: dma_len
Member.description: DMA data transfer length.最大256MB。

RegisterGroup.name: BUS_DMA_AHB_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: BUS_DMA_AHB_CTRL is a DMA AHB burst control register.

Member.name: incr16_en
Member.description:
INC16 burst type enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: incr8_en
Member.description:
INC8 burst type enable.
0: disabled.
1: enabled

Member.name: incr4_en
Member.description:
INC4 burst type enable.
0: disabled.
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: CMD_CONFIG
RegisterGroup.description: CMD_CONFIG is a command configuration register.

Member.name: mem_if_type
Member.description:
Specifies the type of the SPI flash interface in register command operation mode.
000: standard SPI interface type
001: dual-Input/Dual-Output SPI
010: dual-I/O SPI
011: full DIO SPI
100: reserved
101: quad-Input/Dual-Output SPI
110: quad-I/O SPI
111: full QIO SPI

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. The value 0 must be written to this bit.

Member.name: data_cnt
Member.description: The length of the read and written data is N+1 bytes.

Member.name: rw
Member.description:
Indicates that the data is read or written when that data_en is 1.
0: write. Data is written to the flash memory.
1: read. Data is read from the flash memory.

Member.name: data_en
Member.description:
Indicates whether there is data in this operation.
0: no data
1: there is data.

Member.name: dummy_byte_cnt
Member.description:
Dummy byte in register command operation mode.
0: no dummy byte
1: 1 byte
2: 2 bytes
...
7: 7 bytes

Member.name: addr_en
Member.description:
Indicates whether there is an address for the current operation.
0: 0: There is no address
1: There is an address.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
片选选择信号。
0：片选0；
1：片选1。

Member.name: start
Member.description:
Instruction operation start.
0: The operation is complete.
1: The operation starts.
After the operation is complete, the bit returns 0 automatically.

RegisterGroup.name: CMD_INS
RegisterGroup.description: CMD_INS is a command instruction register.

Member.name: reg_ins
Member.description: Instruction code in the mode that the register accesses the flash memory.

RegisterGroup.name: CMD_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: CMD_ADDR is a command address register.

Member.name: cmd_addr
Member.description: Operation address in the mode that the register accesses the flash memory.

RegisterGroup.name: CMD_DATABUF_N
RegisterGroup.description: CMD_DATABUF_N is a command data buffer register.

Member.name: cmd_databuf_n
Member.description:
Data buffer N in the mode that the register accesses the flash memory.
Register offset address 0x400+4Xn.
The variable N can be set to 0 to 15.

RegisterGroup.name: MDIO_RWCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: MDIO_RWCTRL is an MDIO command word register.The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: cpu_data_in
Member.description:
Data used by the MDIO module to perform write operation on the PHY chip.
During write operation, the CPU first writes the 16-bit data to be written to the MDIO to this register.

Member.name: finish
Member.description:
PHY read/write operation complete.
0: Not complete.
1: Complete.
When the read/write operation is required for the second time, the CPU must clear this bit first.

Member.name: rw
Member.description:
PHY read or write access control.
0: Read operation.
1: Write operation.

Member.name: phy_exaddr
Member.description:
Physical address of the external PHY chip.
One MDIO can perform read/write operation on multiple external PHY chips. Each PHY chip has one corresponding address. When the MDIO connects to only one external PHY chip, this bit is equivalent to UD_MDIO_PHYADDR[phy0_addr] or UD_MDIO_PHYADDR[phy1_addr].

Member.name: frq_dv
Member.description:
Frequency division factor for the MDC (the MDIO interface clock) when the MDIO performs the read/write operation on external PHY chips.
Take the frequency 54 MHz of the main clock as an example to describe the matching relationship between frq_dv and MDC frequency.
000: The frequency of the working main clock is divided by 50 and the obtained frequency is 1.1 MHz.
001: The frequency of the working main clock is divided by 100 and the obtained frequency is 552 KHz.
010: The frequency of the working main clock is divided by 150 and the obtained frequency is 368 KHz.
011: The frequency of the working main clock is divided by 200 and the obtained frequency is 276 KHz.
100: The frequency of the working main clock is divided by 250 and the obtained frequency is 221 KHz.
101: The frequency of the working main clock is divided by 300 and the obtained frequency is 184 KHz.
110: The frequency of the working main clock is divided by 350 and the obtained frequency is 158 KHz.
111: The frequency of the working main clock is divided by 400 and the obtained frequency is 138 KHz.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_MDIO_ANEG_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description:
UD_MDIO_ANEG_CTRLPHY is an offset address configuration register for the PHY status.The register does not support soft reset.NOTE
The PHY speed status is indicated by bit[14] of the register with the address of 17, internal_addr_speedis set to 0x11 and speed_index is set to 0xE. In this case, the ETH module reads the bit value as thecurrent working speed mode of the PHY through the MDIO interface.

Member.name: internal_addr_speed
Member.description: Address of the register in the PHY chip to store the status information (speed). The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

Member.name: internal_addr_duplex

Member.name: speed_index
Member.description: Offset address in the PHY status register that is used to store the speed information. The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

Member.name: link_index
Member.description: Offset address in the PHY status register that is used to store the link information. The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

Member.name: duplex_index

Member.name: in_loop_en
Member.description:
Port loopback to internal enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: Loopback to internal enable and loopback to external enable cannot be configured at the same time. When the network interface is in normal state, you need to perform soft reset on the module after loopback to internal enable is configured instead of loopback to external enable and vice versa.

Member.name: ex_loop_en
Member.description:
Port loopback to external enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: Loopback to internal enable and loopback to external enable cannot be configured at the same time. When the network interface is in normal state, you need to perform soft reset on the module after loopback to internal enable is configured instead of loopback to external enable and vice versa.

Member.name: pause_en
Member.description:
Port pause frame TX enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: rx_shframe_en
Member.description:
Port short frame RX enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: If rx_shframe_en is set to 1, the minimum RX frame length allowed by the port is that set by rx_min_thr. If rx_shframe_en is set to 0, the minimum RX frame length allowed by the port is 64 bytes (including CRC) by default.

Member.name: rx_min_thr
Member.description:
Minimum RX frame length allowed by the port.
The value range is from 42 bytes to 63 bytes. The default value is 42 bytes.
Note: If rx_min_thr is set to a value smaller than 42, 42 is used instead of the value.

Member.name: len_max
Member.description:
Maximum RX frame length allowed by the port. The default value is 1518 bytes.
The value is in a range of 1518 bytes to 1535 bytes.
Note: If len_max is set to a value greater than 2000, 2000 is used instead of the value. If len_max is set to a value smaller than 256, 256 is used instead of the value.

RegisterGroup.name: GLB_IRQ_STAT
RegisterGroup.description: GLB_IRQ_STAT is an interrupt status register.The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: int_mdio_finish
Member.description:
Interrupt status indicates whether the MDIO interface completes the operation required by the CPU.
0: Not completed.
1: Completed and an interrupt is generated.
After this interrupt is generated, software determines whether the MDIO completes the operation by querying MDIO_RWCTRL[finish].

Member.name: int_rxd_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status (multi-packet interrupt) for a frame (frames) on the port to be received by the CPU.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. There are frames to be received by the CPU in the RX queue.
After this interrupt is generated, software determines whether there are frames to be received by querying GLB_IRQ_RAW[iraw_rxd_up].

Member.name: int_freeeq_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status indicates that the status of the port output queue is changed from nonempty to empty, that is, the status of the TX queue buffer is changed from nonempty to empty, that is, the status of the TX queue buffer is changed from nonempty to empty. In this case, the CPU can write a group of new frames to be transmitted.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
After this interrupt is generated, software determines whether the current TX queue is empty by querying UD_GLB_ADDRQ_STAT[eq_cnt]. If the current TX queue is not empty, it indicates that the interrupt is invalid.

Member.name: int_stat_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for port status changes, indicating that an interrupt is generated when the MDIO obtains the speed change, duplex mode change, and link status change of the PHY chip in auto-adaption mode.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The port status changes.
After this interrupt is generated, software determines which status changes according to the configuration of UD_MDIO_IRQENA.

Member.name: int_duplex_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for port duplex mode changes.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The duplex mode changes.
After this interrupt is generated, software determines whether the duplex mode changes by querying UD_MAC_STAT_CHANGE[duplex_stat_ch].

Member.name: int_speed_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for port speed mode changes.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The speed mode changes.
After this interrupt is generated, software determines whether the speed mode changes by querying UD_MAC_STAT_CHANGE[speed_stat_ch].

Member.name: int_link_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for port link status changes.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The link status changes.
After this interrupt is generated, software determines whether the link status changes by querying UD_MAC_STAT_CHANGE[link_stat_ch].

Member.name: int_tx_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for the completion of transmitting a frame from the CPU by the port.
0: Not completed.
1: Completed and an interrupt is generated.
After this interrupt is generated, software determines whether to release the buffer of the TX frames by querying the current TX queue address eq_out_index in UD_GLB_QSTAT.

Member.name: int_rx_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for frames on the port to be received by the CPU.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. There are frames to be received by the CPU in the RX queue.
After this interrupt program is started, software determines whether frames are received by querying the GLB_IRQ_RAW[iraw_rxd_up] signal.
