RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_CMD
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_CMD is a port command and status register.

Member.name: cmd_icc
Member.description:
Port communication control signal.
0x0: No operation. It indicates that the next port status request is allowed.
0x1: Request to enable the port to be in the active status.
0x2: Request to enable the port to be in the partial status.
0x6: Request to enable the port to be in the slumber status.
Other values: reserved
When the software writes any of the preceding values rather than the reserved value, the controller clears the cmd_icc bit after performing related operations. When the software requests the current status of the port, the controller clears the cmd_icc bit directly. If the software requests the port status change from a low-power status to another low-power status, such as from the partial status to the slumber status, it needs to request the status change from the partial status to the active status, and then to the slumber status.

Member.name: cmd_asp
Member.description:
Slumber or partial status select for power management.
0: proactively enter the partial status.
1: proactively enter the slumber status.

Member.name: cmd_alpe
Member.description:
Automatic power management enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled If SATA_PORT_CI and SATA_PORT_SACT are cleared, the controller enters the power-management status automatically. To be specific, if cmd_asp is 1, the controller enters the partial status; if cmd_asp is 0, the controller enters the slumber status.

Member.name: cmd_dlae
Member.description:
LED drive enable in ATAPI mode.
0: The LED pin can be driven when cmd_atapi is 0 and commands are being executed.
1: The LED pin can be driven when commands are being executed.

Member.name: cmd_atapi
Member.description:
ATAPI device indication.
0: The current device is not an ATAPI device.
1: The current device is an ATAPI device.

Member.name: cmd_esp
Member.description: Fixed at 1, indicating that the external SATA device is supported.

Member.name: cmd_pma
Member.description:
Port multiplier detection indication.
0: No port multiplier is connected to the port.
1: A port multiplier is connected to the port.

Member.name: cmd_cr
Member.description:
Command list processing indication.
0: No command is being executed.
1: A command is being executed.

Member.name: cmd_fr
Member.description:
FIS receive processing indication.
0: No FIS is being received.
1: An FIS is being received.

Member.name: cmd_ccs
Member.description:
Slot number of the current command.
This field is valid when cmd_st is 1 and is cleared when cmd_st is 0.

Member.name: cmd_fre
Member.description:
FIS receive enable control.
0: forbid to write the received FISs to the system memory
1: enable the received FISs and write them to the system memory
The software needs to set the receive FIS base address register SATA_PORT_FB before enabling this bit to receive FISs. When cmd_st is 1, this bit must be set to 1.

Member.name: cmd_clo
Member.description:
BSY/DQR clear control. The software can forcibly clear the BSY and DRQ bits through this bit and transmit commands to the device.
0: no effect
1: Clear the BSY and DRQ bits of SATA_PORT_TFD[tfd_sts]. After the BSY and DRQ bits are 0, the cmd_clo bit is cleared automatically.
The cmd_clo bit can be written as 1 only before the value of cmd_st is changed from 0 to 1. In addition, the software must write 1 to cmd_st after the cmd_clo bit is cleared.

Member.name: cmd_sud
Member.description:
Spin-up device control.
0: When SATA_PORT_SCTL[det] is 0, the controller enters the listen mode.
1: After the system is powered on or the HBA is reset, the controller is enabled to transmit a COMRESET sequence to initialize the hardware device.

Member.name: cmd_st
Member.description:
Command list processing enable.
0: The controller enters the idle status.
1: The controller processes the commands from slot 0 that are identified as valid slots by SATA_PORT_CI.
Note: The cmd_st bit can be set to 1 only after cmd_fre is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_TFD
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_TFD is a port task file register.

Member.name: tfd_err
Member.description:
Task file error.
The controller updates this field after receiving a D2H register FIS, a PIO setup FIS, or an SDB FIS.

Member.name: tfd_sts
Member.description:
Task file status.
bit[7]: BSY bit. It indicates that the device is busy.
bit[6:4]: The meaning of this field varies according to commands.
bit[3]: DRQ bit. It indicates that there is the data to be transferred in the device.
bit[2:1]: The meaning of this field varies according to commands.
bit[0]: ERR bit. It indicates that an error occurs during the data transfer.
The controller updates this field after receiving a D2H register FIS, a PIO setup FIS, or an SDB FIS.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SIG
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_SIG is a port signature register.

Member.name: signature
Member.description:
LBA address and sector addressing. The allocated addresses are as follows:
bit[31:24]: LBA upper-bit address
bit[23:16]: LBA middle-bit address
bit[15:8]: LBA lower-bit address
bit[7:0]: number of sectors
The controller updates this register when receiving the first D2H register FIS after the hardware device is reset.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SSTS
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_SSTS is a port status register.

Member.name: pxssts_ipm
Member.description:
Current port status.
0x0: No devices exist or no communication is set up.
0x1: active
0x2: partial
0x6: slumber
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pxssts_spd
Member.description:
Port negotiation speed.
0x0: No devices exist or no communication is set up.
0x1: Rate 1 is negotiated for communication.
0x2: Rate 2 is negotiated for communication.
0x3: Rate 3 is negotiated for communication.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pxssts_det
Member.description:
Device detection and PHY status.
0x0: No device is detected and no PHY communication is set up.
0x1: A device is detected but no PHY communication is set up.
0x3: A device is detected but the PHY communication is set up.
0x4: The PHY is offline or in the built-in self test (BIST) status.
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SCTL
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_SCTL is a port control register.

Member.name: pxsctl_ipm
Member.description:
Port power management status control.
0x0: no requirements
0x1: forbid to enter the partial status.
0x2: forbid to enter the slumber status
0x3: forbid to enter the partial or slumber state.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pxsctl_spd
Member.description:
Port communication speed control.
0x0: no requirements
0x1: limit the communication speed to rate 1
0x2: limit the communication speed to rate 2
0x3: limit the communication speed to rate 3
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pxsctl_det
Member.description:
Device detection and port initialization control.
0x0: no device detection or initialization request
0x1: request the port to reset the initialization sequence COMRESET
0x4: force the port to be offline
Other values: reserved
When pxsctl_det is set to 1, the controller transmits the COMRESET sequence to the device. In this case, to ensure that the device receives the COMRESET sequence, the software must retain the value 1 of pxsctl_det for at least 1 ms.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SERR
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_SERR is an error diagnosis status register.

Member.name: diag_x
Member.description:
Device detection status.
0: No COMINIT signal transmitted from the device is detected.
1: A COMINIT signal transmitted from the device is detected.

Member.name: diag_f
Member.description:
Detection status of the unknown FIS.
0: No unknown FIS is received.
1: An unknown FIS is received and this bit is set to 1 when the cyclic redundancy check (CRC) is correct.

Member.name: diag_s
Member.description:
Link layer error status.
0: No status transition error occurs at the link layer.
1: A status transition error occurs at the link layer.

Member.name: diag_h
Member.description:
Handshake error status.
0: No R_ERR primitive transmitted from the device is received.
1: One or more R_ERR primitives transmitted from the device are received.

Member.name: diag_c
Member.description:
CRC error status.
0: No CRC error occurs during FIS receiving.
1: A CRC error occurs during FIS receiving.

Member.name: diag_b
Member.description:
Decoding error status.
0: No 8B/10B decoding error is detected.
1: An 8B/10B decoding error is detected.

Member.name: diag_w
Member.description:
COMWAKE status.
0: No COMWAKE signal transmitted from the device is detected.
1: A COMWAKE signal transmitted from the device is detected.

Member.name: diag_i
Member.description:
PHY internal error status.
0: No PHY internal error is detected.
1: A PHY internal error is detected.

Member.name: diag_n
Member.description:
PhyRdy signal change status.
0: The PhyRdy signal is not changed.
1: The PhyRdy signal is changed.
This bit is set to 1 when the value of the PhyRdy signal is changed from 1 to 0 or from 0 to 1.

Member.name: err_p
Member.description:
SATA protocol incompliance error status.
0: No device behaviors do not comply with the SATA protocol.
1: Some device behaviors do not comply with the SATA protocol.

Member.name: err_t
Member.description:
Data integrity error status.
0: No data integrity error is detected.
1: A data integrity error is detected.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SACT
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_SACT is an NCQ command identifier control register.

Member.name: port_sact
Member.description:
NCQ command identifier control.
Each bit of this register maps to a tag ID and an NCQ command in the memory. To be specific, bit[31:0] map to the commands of slot 31–0 and tag 31–0 respectively. The following describes the meaning of each bit by taking bit[3] as an example:
0: The slot 3 command is a non-NCQ command.
1: The slot 3 command is an NCQ command. Before setting SATA_PORT_SACT bit[3] to 1, the software must clear SATA_PORT_CI bit[3]. After the command data transfer, the device transmits an SDB FIS. Then, the controller clears SATA_PORT_SACT bit[3] based on the SActive in the FIS.
The software can set SATA_PORT_SACT only when cmd_st is 1. When cmd_st is 0, all bits of SATA_PORT_SACT are cleared.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_CI
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_CI is a command transmit control register.

Member.name: port_ci
Member.description:
Control for the commands to be transmitted.
Each bit of this register maps to a command in the memory. To be specific, bit[31:0] map to the commands of slot 31–0 respectively. The following describes the meaning of each bit by taking bit[3] as an example:
0: There is no slot 3 command to be transmitted and executed.
1: A slot 3 command is created in the memory. Then the controller can transmit this command. After running this command and receiving a corresponding FIS, the controller clears SATA_PORT_CI bit[3] and the BSY, DRQ, and ERR bits of SATA_PORT_TFD.
The bits of SATA_PORT_CI can be set to 1 only when cmd_st is 1 and all bits of SATA_PORT_CI are cleared when cmd_st is 0.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SNTF
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_SNTF is an async notification event indication register.

Member.name: pxsntf_pmn
Member.description:
Async notification event status.
If the controller receives an SDB FIS from the device on the PM port and the N bit of this FIS is 1, the controller sets the bit of this register corresponding to this port number to 1.
The following describes the meaning of each bit by taking bit[3] as an example:
0: No async notification event occurs on the device whose PM port number is 3.
1: An async notification event occurs on the device whose PM port number is 3.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_FIFOTH
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_FIFOTH is a receive FIFO threshold register.

Member.name: dmac_rxfifo_th
Member.description: Flow control threshold of the DMAC receive FIFO. During data reception, if the data amount in the DMAC FIFO is above the threshold, the controller starts to control the data flow.

Member.name: rxfifo_th_sel
Member.description:
Flow control FIFO select.
0: The flow control for the link receive FIFO is valid.
1: The flow control for the DMAC receive FIFO is valid.

Member.name: link_rxfifo_th
Member.description: Flow control threshold of the link receive FIFO. During data reception, if the data amount in the DMAC FIFO is above the threshold, the controller starts to control the data flow.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_HBA
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_HBA is an HBA test status register.

Member.name: p_curr_st
Member.description: Current status of the HBA_PINIT_STATE state machine.

Member.name: ndr_curr_st
Member.description: Current status of the HBA_NDR_STATE state machine.

Member.name: cfis_curr_st
Member.description: Current status of the HBA_CFIS_STATE state machine.

Member.name: pio_curr_st
Member.description: Current status of the HBA_PIO_STATE state machine.

Member.name: pm_curr_st

Member.name: err_curr_st
Member.description: Current status of the HBA_ERR_STATE state machine.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_LINK
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_LINK is a link test status register.

Member.name: link_curr_st
Member.description: Current status of the LINK_CTL_STATE state machine.

Member.name: link_df_fifo_full
Member.description:
Full flag of the link frequency difference FIFO.

1: full

Member.name: link_df_fifo_empty
Member.description:
Empty flag of the link frequency difference FIFO.
0: not empty
1: empty

Member.name: link_df_fifo_count
Member.description: Data amount in the link frequency difference FIFO.

Member.name: link_rx_fifo_full
Member.description:
Full flag of the link receive FIFO.
0: not full
1: full

Member.name: link_rx_fifo_empty
Member.description:
Empty flag of the link receive FIFO.
0: not empty
1: empty

Member.name: link_rx_fifo_count
Member.description: Data amount in the link receive FIFO.

Member.name: link_tx_fifo_full
Member.description:
Full flag of the link transmit FIFO.
0: not full
1: full

Member.name: link_tx_fifo_empty
Member.description:
Empty flag of the link transmit FIFO.
0: not empty
1: empty

Member.name: link_tx_fifo_count
Member.description: Data amount in the link transmit FIFO.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_DMA1
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_DMA1 is DMAC test status register 1.

Member.name: txdmac_cur_state
Member.description: Current status of the SATA_TX_DMAC state machine.

Member.name: txdmac_prd_i
Member.description: I bit in the entry of the PRD linked list of SATA_TX_DAMC.

Member.name: tx_entry_dbc_cnt
Member.description: Down counter in SATA_TX_DMAC. It indicates the number of data bytes in the current entry.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_DMA2
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_DMA2 is DMAC test status register 2.

Member.name: tx_data_fis_cnt
Member.description: Down counter in SATA_TX_DMAC. It indicates the number of data FIS bytes during the operation of PIO, legacy DMA, or first party DMA. For the PIO operation, the initial value is equal to the value of transcount in the PIO setup FIS; for the legacy DMA or first party DMA operation, the initial value is 16'h2000 (2048 DWORD).

Member.name: tx_cmdh_prdtl
Member.description: Down counter in SATA_TX_DMAC. The parameter in the command header indicates the number of entries in the PRDT.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_DMA3
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_DMA3 is DMAC test status register 3.

Member.name: tx_fpdma_tran_cnt
Member.description: Down counter in SATA_TX_DMAC. It indicates the number of data FIS bytes during the first party DMA operation.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_DMA4
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_DMA4 is DMAC test status register 4.

Member.name: rxdmac_cur_state
Member.description: Current status of the SATA_RX_DMAC state machine.

Member.name: rxdmac_prd_i
Member.description: I bit in the entry of the PRD linked list of SATA_RX_DAMC.

Member.name: rx_entry_dbc_cnt
Member.description: Down counter in SATA_RX_DMAC. It indicates the number of data bytes in the current entry.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_DMA5
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_DMA5 is DMAC test status register 5.

Member.name: rx_data_fis_cnt
Member.description: Down counter in SATA_RX_DMAC. It indicates the number of data FIS bytes during the operation of PIO, legacy DMA, or first party DMA. For the PIO operation, the initial value is equal to the value of transcount in the PIO setup FIS; for the legacy DMA or first party DMA operation, the initial value is 0x2000 (2048 DWORD).

Member.name: rx_cmdh_prdtl
Member.description: Down counter in SATA_RX_DMAC. The parameter in the command header indicates the number of entries in the PRDT.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_DMA6
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_DMA6 is DMAC test status register 6.

Member.name: rx_fpdma_tran_cnt
Member.description: Down counter in SATA_RX_DMAC. It indicates the number of data FIS bytes during the first party DMA operation. The initial value is equal to the value of transcount in the DMA setup FIS.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_DMA7
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_DMA7 is DMAC test status register 7.

Member.name: pio_op

PIO operation indication.
0: The current command is not used for the PIO operation.
1: The current command is used for the PIO operation.

Member.name: fpdma_op
Member.description:
First party DMA operation indication.
0: The current command is not used for the first party DMA operation.
1: The current command is used for the first party DMA operation.

Member.name: dmac_rx_fifo_full
Member.description:
Full status of SATA_DMAC_RX_FIFO.

Member.name: dmac_rx_fifo_empty

Empty status of SATA_DMAC_TX_FIFO.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_PHYCTL

Member.name: phy_disable
Member.description:
Whether to use the PHY.
0: used
1: not used

Member.name: phy_calibrated

Whether to calibrate the PHY.

1: calibrated

Member.name: spd_change_ack
Member.description:
Whether the rate is allowed to switch.
0: not allowed
1: allowed

Member.name: dp_rdy
Member.description:
Whether the PHY is ready to transmit data.
0: not ready
1: ready

Member.name: bist_tx_fspd

Whether the clock frequency is forced to transmit in BIST mode.

Member.name: neg_mode_b

Negotiation mode B select.

Transmit control signal. It indicates whether to support the 3G mode.

Member.name: los_ctl

LOS detection control.

Member.name: rx_dpll_mode

Control mode of the receive DPLL.

Member.name: rx_eq_val

Member.name: rx_term_en

Receive termination enable.

Member.name: tx_calc

Member.name: tx_atten

Transmit attenuation control.

11X: reserved

Member.name: tx_boost
Member.description: Transmit boost control. The value is –20 log [1 – (tx_boost[3:0] + 0.5)/32] dB.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_PHYSTS

RegisterGroup.name: SPICR0
RegisterGroup.description: SPICR0 is SPI control register 0.

Member.name: scr
Member.description:
Serial clock rate, ranging from 0 to 255. The value of the SCR is used to generate the transmit and receive bit rates of the SPI. The formula is as follows: FSPICLK/(CPSDVSR (1 + SCR).
CPSDVSR is an even ranging from 2 to 254, and it is configured by SPICPSR.

Member.name: sph
Member.description: SPICLKOUT phase. For details, see the "SPI frame format of Peripheral Bus Timings" in section 14.2.4.

Member.name: spo
Member.description: SPICLKOUT polarity. For details, see the "SPI Frame Format of Peripheral Bus Timings" in section 14.2.4.

Member.name: frf
Member.description:
Frame format select.
00: Motorola SPI frame format
01: TI synchronous serial frame format
10: National microwire frame format
11: reserved

Member.name: dss
Member.description:
Data width.
0011: 4 bits
1000: 9 bits
1101: 14 bits
0100: 5 bits
1001: 10 bits
1110: 15 bits
0101: 6 bits
1010: 11 bits
1111: 16 bits
0110: 7 bits
1011: 12 bits
0111: 8 bits
1100: 13 bits
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: SPICR1
RegisterGroup.description: SPICR1 is SPI control register 1.

Member.name: waiten
Member.description:
Wait enable. This bit is valid when the SPICR0[FRF] is set to the national microwire frame format.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: waitval
Member.description: Number of waiting beats between read and write when in the national microwire frame format. When WaitEn is 1 and the frame format is national microwire, WaitVal is valid.

Member.name: bigend
Member.description:
Data endian mode.
0: little endian
1: big endian

Member.name: ms
Member.description:
Master or slave mode. This bit can be changed only when the SPI is disabled.
0: master mode (default value)
1: reserved

Member.name: sse
Member.description:
SPI enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: lbm
Member.description:
Loopback mode.
0: A normal serial port operation is enabled.
1: The output of the transmit serial shift register is connected to the input of the receive serial shift register.

RegisterGroup.name: SPIDR
RegisterGroup.description: SPIDR is a data register.

Member.name: data
Member.description:
transmit or receive FIFO.
Read: receive FIFO
Write: transmit FIFO
If the data is less than 16 bits, the data must be aligned to the right. The transmit logic ignores the unused upper bits, and the receive logic automatically aligns the data to the right.

RegisterGroup.name: SPISR
RegisterGroup.description: SPISR is a status register.

Member.name: bsy
Member.description:
SPI busy flag.
0: idle
1: busy

Member.name: rff
Member.description:
Whether the receive FIFO is full.
0: not full
1: full.

Member.name: rne
Member.description:
Whether the receive FIFO is not empty.
0: empty
1: not empty

Member.name: tnf
Member.description:
Whether the transmit FIFO is not full.
0: full
1: not full

Member.name: tfe
Member.description:
Whether the transmit FIFO is empty.
0: not empty
1: empty

RegisterGroup.name: SPICPSR
RegisterGroup.description: SPICPSR is a clock divider register.

Member.name: cpsdvsr
Member.description: Clock divider. The value must be an even ranging from 2 to 254. It depends on the frequency of the input clock SPICLK. The LSB is read as 0.

RegisterGroup.name: SPIIMSC
RegisterGroup.description: SCIIMSC is an interrupt mask register. The value 0 indicates an interrupt is masked and thevalue1 indicates an interrupt is not masked.

Member.name: txim
Member.description:
Transmit FIFO interrupt mask.
0: The interrupt masked when only half of or less data is left in the transmit FIFO.
1: The interrupt not masked when only half of or less data is left the transmit FIFO.

Member.name: rxim
Member.description:
Receive FIFO interrupt mask.
0: The interrupt is masked when only half of or less data is left in the receive FIFO.
1: The interrupt is not masked when only half of or less data is left in the receive FIFO.

Member.name: rtim
Member.description:
Receive timeout interrupt mask.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: rorim
Member.description:
Receive overflow interrupt mask.
0: masked
1: not masked
When the value is 1, the hardware stream control function is enabled. That is, when the receive FIFO is full, the SPI stops transmitting data.

RegisterGroup.name: SPITXFIFOCR
RegisterGroup.description: SPITXFIFOCR is a transmit FIFO control register.

Member.name: txintsize
Member.description:
Threshold for generating the transmit FIFO request interrupt. That is, when the number of data segments in the transmit FIFO is less than or equal to the value of TXINTSize, TXRIS is valid.
000: 1
001: 4
010: 8
011: 16
100: 32
101: 64
110: 64
111: 64

Member.name: dmatxbrsize
Member.description:
Threshold for generating the transmit FIFO request DMA transfer burst. That is, when the number of data segments in the transmit FIFO is less than or equal to the configured value (256 – DMATXBRSize), DMATXBREQ is valid. The width of the transmit FIFO is 16 bits.
000: 1
001: 4
010: 8
011: 16
100: 32
101: 64
110: 128
111: 128

RegisterGroup.name: SPIRXFIFOCR
RegisterGroup.description: SPIRXFIFOCR is a receive FIFO control register.

Member.name: rxintsize
Member.description:
Threshold for generating the receive FIFO request interrupt. That is, when the number of data segments in the transmit FIFO is less than or equal to the configured value (256 – RXINTSize), RXRIS is valid. The width of the receive FIFO is 16 bits.
000: 1
001: 4
010: 8
011: 16
100: 32
101: 64
110: 64
111: 64

Member.name: dmarxbrsize
Member.description:
Burst transfer threshold. When this threshold is reached, the receive FIFO asks the DMA to perform a burst transfer. That is, when number of data segments in the transmit FIFO is less than or equal to the value of DMARXBRSize, DMARXBREQ is valid.
000: 1
001: 4
010: 8
011: 16
100: 32
101: 64
110: 128
111: 224

RegisterGroup.name: UART_DR
RegisterGroup.description: UART_DR is a UART data register that stores the received data and the data to be transmitted.The receive status can be queried by reading this register.

Member.name: oe
Member.description:
Overflow error.
0: No overflow error occurs.
1: An overflow error occurs. That is, a data segment is received when the receive FIFO is full.

Member.name: be
Member.description:
Break error.
0: No break error occurs.
1: A break error occurs. That is, the time of receive data input signal keeping low is longer than a full word transfer. A full word consists of a start bit, a data bit, a parity bit, and a stop bit.

Member.name: pe
Member.description:
Parity error.
0: No parity error occurs.
1: A parity error occurs.

Member.name: fe
Member.description:
Frame error.
0: No frame error occurs.
1: A frame error (namely, stop bit error) occurs.

Member.name: data
Member.description: Data received and to be transmitted.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_RSR
RegisterGroup.description:
UART_RSR is a receive status register or error clear register.
  • It acts as the receive status register when being read.
  • It acts as the error clear register when being written.You can query the receive status by reading UART_DR. The status information about thebreak, frame, and parity read from UART_DR has priority over that read from UART_RSR.That is, the status read from UART_DR changes faster than that read from UART_RSR.UART_RSR is reset when any value is written to it.

Member.name: oe
Member.description:
Overflow error.
0: No overflow error occurs.
1: An overflow error occurs.
When the FIFO is full, the next data segment cannot be written to the FIFO and an overflow occurs in the shift register. Therefore, the contents in the FIFO are valid. In this case, the CPU must read the data immediately to spare the FIFO.

Member.name: be
Member.description:
Break error.
0: No break error occurs.
1: A break error occurs.
A break error occurs when the time of the receive data signal keeping low is longer than a full word transfer. A full word consists of a start bit, a data bit, a parity bit, and a stop bit.

Member.name: pe
Member.description:
Parity error.
0: No parity error occurs.
1: A parity error occurs when the received data is checked.
In FIFO mode, the error is associated with the data at the top of the FIFO.

Member.name: fe
Member.description:
Frame error.
0: No frame error occurs.
1: The stop bit of the received data is incorrect. The valid stop bit is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_FR
RegisterGroup.description: UART_FR is a UART flag register.

Member.name: txfe
Member.description:
The definition of the bit is determined by the status of UART_LCR_H [fen].
If UART_LCR_H [fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the transmit holding register is empty.
If UART_LCR_H [fen] is 1, the bit is set to 1 when the transmit FIFO is empty.

Member.name: rxff
Member.description:
The definition of the bit is determined by the status of UART_LCR_H [fen].
If UART_LCR_H [fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the receive holding register is full.
If UART_LCR_H [fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the receive FIFO is full.

Member.name: txff
Member.description:
The definition of the bit is determined by the status of UART_LCR_H [fen].
If UART_LCR_H [fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the transmit holding register is full.
If UART_LCR_H [fen] is 1, the bit is set to 1 when the transmit FIFO is full.

Member.name: rxfe
Member.description:
The definition of the bit is determined by the status of UART_LCR_H [fen].
If UART_LCR_H [fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the receive holding register is empty.
If UART_LCR_H [fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the receive FIFO is empty.

Member.name: busy
Member.description:
UART busy/idle status.
0: The UART is idle or data transmission is complete.
1: The UART is busy in transmitting data.
If the bit is set to 1, the status is kept until the entire byte (including all stop bits) is transmitted from the shift register.
Regardless of whether the UART is enabled, this bit is set to 1 when the transmit FIFO is not empty.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IBRD
RegisterGroup.description: UART_IBRD is an integral baud rate register.

Member.name: bauddivint
Member.description: Clock frequency divider corresponding to the integral part of the baud rate. All bits are cleared after reset.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_FBRD
RegisterGroup.description:
UART_FBRD is a fractional baud rate register.CAUTION
  • The values of UART_IBRD and UART_FBRD can be updated only after the current datais transmitted and received completely.
  • The minimum clock frequency divider is 1 and the maximum divider is 65,535 (216 - 1).
  • That is, UART_IBRD cannot be 0 and UART_FBRD is ignored if UART_IBRD is 0.Similarly, if UART_IBRD is equal to 65,535 (0xFFFF), UART_IBRD must be 0. IfAssume that UART_FBRD is set to 0x1E and UART_IBRD is set to 0x01. This indicatesthat the integral part of the clock frequency divider is 30 and the fractional part of theclock frequency divider is 0.015625. Therefore, the clock frequency divider is 30.015625.
  • Baud rate of the UART = Internal bus frequency/(16 x clock divider) = Internal busfrequency/(16 x 30.015625).Offset Address

Member.name: banddivfrac
Member.description: Clock frequency divider corresponding to the fractional part of the baud rate. All bits are cleared after reset.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_LCR_H
RegisterGroup.description: UART_LCR_H is a transfer mode control register. The registers UART_LCR_H,UART_FBRD are updated, UART_LCR_H must be updated at the same time.Total Reset Value

Member.name: sps
Member.description:
Parity select.
When bit 1, bit 2, and bit 7 of this register are set to 1, the parity bit is 0 during transmission and detection.
When bit 1 and bit 7 of this register are set to 1 and bit 2 is set to 0, the parity bit is 1 during transmission and detection.
When bit 1, bit 2, and bit 7 are cleared, the stick parity bit is disabled.

Member.name: wlen
Member.description:
Count of bits in a transmitted or received frame.
00: 5 bits
01: 6 bits
10: 7 bits
11: 8 bits

Member.name: fen
Member.description:
Transmit/receive FIFO enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: stp2
Member.description:
2-bit stop bit at the end of a transmitted frame.
0: There is no 2-bit stop bit at the end of the transmitted frame.
1: There is a 2-bit stop bit at the end of the transmitted frame.
The receive logic does not check for the 2-bit stop bit during data reception.

Member.name: eps
Member.description:
Parity select during data transmission and reception.
0: The odd parity is generated or checked during data transmission and reception.
1: The even parity is generated or checked during data transmission and reception.
When UART_LCR_H [fen] is 0, this bit becomes invalid.

Member.name: pen
Member.description:
Parity enable.
0: The parity is disabled.
1: The parity is generated on the transmit side and checked on the receive side.

Member.name: brk
Member.description:
Break transmit.
0: invalid
1: After the current data transmission is complete, UTXD outputs low level continuously.
Note: This bit must retain 1 during the period of at least two full frames to ensure the break command is executed properly. In general, the bit must be set to 0.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_CR
RegisterGroup.description: UART_CR is a UART control register.To configure UART_CR, perform the following steps:Write 0 to UART_CR[uarten] to disable the UART.Wait until the current data transmission or reception is complete.Clear UART_LCR_H [fen].Configure UART_CR.Write 1 to UART_CR[uarten] to enable the UART.----End

Member.name: ctsen
Member.description:
CTS hardware flow control enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled. Data is transmitted only when the nUARTCTS signal is valid.

Member.name: rtsen
Member.description:
RTS hardware flow control enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled. The data reception request is raised only when the receive FIFO has available space.

Member.name: rts
Member.description:
Request transmit.
This bit is the inversion of the status output signal nUARTRTS of the UART modem.
0: The output signal retains.
1: When this bit is set to 1, the output signal is 0.

Member.name: dtr
Member.description:
Data transmit ready.
This bit is the inversion of the status output signal nUARTDTR of the UART modem.
0: The output signal retains.
1: When this bit is set to 1, the output signal is 0.

Member.name: rxe
Member.description:
UART receive enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data reception, the current data reception is stopped abnormally.

Member.name: txe
Member.description:
UART transmit enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data transmission, the current data transmission is stopped abnormally.

Member.name: lbe
Member.description:
Loopback enable.
0: disabled
1: UARTTXD is looped back to UARTRXD.

Member.name: uarten
Member.description:
UART enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
If the UART is disabled during data reception and transmission, the data transfer is stopped abnormally.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IFLS
RegisterGroup.description: UART_IFLS is an interrupt FIFO threshold select register. It is used to set a threshold fortriggering a FIFO interrupt (UART_TXINTR or UART_RXINTR).

Member.name: rxiflsel
Member.description:
Receive interrupt FIFO threshold select. A receive interrupt is triggered when any of the following conditions is met:
000: receive FIFO ≥ 1/8 full
001: receive FIFO ≥ 1/4 full
010: receive FIFO ≥ 1/2 full
011: receive FIFO ≥ 3/4 full
100: receive FIFO ≥ 7/8 full
101–111: reserved

Member.name: txiflsel
Member.description:
Transmit interrupt FIFO threshold select. A transmit interrupt is triggered when any of the following conditions is met:
000: transmit FIFO ≤ 1/8 full
001: transmit FIFO ≤ 1/4 full
011: transmit FIFO ≤ 3/4 full
010: transmit FIFO ≤ 1/2 full
100: transmit FIFO ≤ 7/8 full
101–111: reserved
